intro: Mansonia dipikae, commonly known as the African mangrove, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Africa, particularly coastal regions where it thrives in brackish water environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its thick, waxy leaves and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. It plays an important role in stabilizing coastal soils and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms. Due to its adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
